name: 5-methyl-3-(2,4,6-trimethylphenyl)-1H-pyrazole
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2485
Reason: 5-methyl-3-(2,4,6-trimethylphenyl)-1H-pyrazole has a melting point that we can analyze by considering its structural components. The basic unit for our comparison will be 1-methyl-3-phenyl-1H-pyrazole, which has a melting point of 100 degrees Celsius. The methyl group introduces a rigid structure, which raises the melting point by approximately +5 degrees Celsius. The trimethylphenyl group (C1=C(C=C1)C) adds approximately +30 degrees Celsius due to the increase in molecular weight and van der Waals forces. The pyrazole ring itself contributes approximately +20 degrees Celsius due to the presence of a nitrogen atom, which enhances the crystalline structure and the ability for hydrogen bonding.
